Oh children, I have come to you with this book, which is the final part of medical science, in order to complete my life's work, and through its explanations and declarations, I believe that it will be useful to you as well, for it treats the art of surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art. A doctor who received a stipend from a duke of our land came to see me, and he had a blacksmith treat a fracture in his body; and because the doctor was ignorant of it, he treated the wound with pulvinas and stakes under strong tension, and did not apply any breath or respiration to the wound.

Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	It begins with a general treatment for all diseases.

E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	Wise sons, know that the secret of healing by cautery is in the focus and its goodness, which is over cautery being combined with medicine, for the fire is simple, the action of which does not penetrate to any other member besides the one which is cauterized, and it feels only a little damage.

E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And wise sons, know that they do not agree with time in the period when it is convenient to make cautery and pause at the best time of spring.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	I say that cautery is convenient at all times, because the damage caused by time's accident is submerged in the benefit of applying cautery, and even more so if the cautery is for painful or necessary pains, hard and violent ones, which do not tolerate delay, so that they are feared by those who come with malice, which is greater than slight injury entering through time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen. And the cause is not simply because of the gall that exists in you, for cautery is only a substitute for medicine which alters the complexity and dries out the humidity which are the causes of pain.

And it is possible that his illness will return in some hour of time, according to the complexity of the illness and the location of its ailment, and its virtue, so that what is prepared in the body of him through the addition of unnecessary things in him, and what is conveyed to him in his acquisition in viands and similar causes; unless the illness in which cautery is applied is a subtle illness in a few superfluous parts and humidities, as for example, a cautery of tooth for pain and similarity to that, it may not return that pain in him, but this is done in small points.

The cause is the opposite; and I understand that cautery is considered the last remedy of medicine only when administering various methods of cure for certain illnesses, and those medicines do not work, and therefore, in the end, it administers cauterization, which affords some benefit to that.

E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	It was said that cautery of silver is better than cautery of iron, and not so because the silver is equal to it and superior in its substance.

They said that the location of cautery does not matter, as it is not absolutely true, because I have already shown and experimented with it and found that it does not work for all cases, but works better for certain bodies, and that cautery of iron is good and better than silver as they claimed; however, when you perform cautery with fire from gold, it's not for your declaration, because it depends on the quantity you want to achieve by the weight of the gold, and how you prepare yourself to receive the burn; and if you place yourself over the flame until the gold is burned, some thin sheets are added to the heat so that the artisan can take hold of them.

E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And then you cautery him with a small clove of garlic, two cauteries on each of the two big toes, and cut off those little hairs.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And be careful not to burn that.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And regarding the cautery clove, this is the form.

Capitol .xvii.	Chapter XVII.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	On the cautery of fistula that is in the tear duct of the foot.

le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which is shaped like a candle or the cross of a turning iron, from one end to which the cauterizing instrument is made.

E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	If it has not been opened, then open it and extract the pus.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel. And another method of cauterizing a fistula that they used to say was this: penetrate the location of the fistula and press on that same subtle fissure, which is the shape of it; take one ounce of melted lead and wrap your hand around it with good retention, so that the ulcer does not worsen because the lead does not come into contact with the heel of that; and cover that area, foot in alum or water, where the lead adheres to the location of the fistula and heals it through marvelous cure.

If the fistula is healed as has been said about cauterizing and healing, then it is well done; if not, then it is necessary to administer treatment through the nose and reduce the fistula into the nasal passage according to where it comes.

De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	Of the cauterization of tooth pain.

Observe wisely the size of the intestine in the hour of your cautery, that you do not burn that intestine lest the patient come into mortal danger or another great malady.
E sapias que quan tu am le cauteri no atenhas le os, no confereys la tua operacio.	Be aware that when you have the cautery and do not touch the bone, do not perform the operation.
E cove que·l cauteri dels enfants sia subtil segon le gran e la mesura de lor.	The cauterization of children should be subtle according to their size and measure.
E aprop cura le loc del cauteri per tres dias am boder entro que sia remauguda la scara del foc.	Keep the wound of the cauterization clean for three days before it is healed and the char of fire falls off.
E aprop cura aquel am les autres enguentz entro que sia sanat.	Keep that wound closed, along with others that are infected, until healing occurs.
E le malaute sia jasent sobre le sieu dos per xl dias entro que sia sigillat le loc e la plagua.	The patient should lie on their back for forty days, until the wound is sealed and the plague is cured.
E cove que pauses le nutriment de lu segon la longitut del temps de la curacio de lu le qual le linesca le ventre de lu, e que le budel no yesca fora deves le esforsament de guerir.	It is necessary to pause the nutrition of him according to the length of time of his recovery, lest he waste his stomach, and that the intestine does not come out because of his effort to heal.
E aprop quan se vol levar aprop xl dias, lahoras aministra liament decentment fayt, e tengua aquel per autres xl jorns.	And after forty days, he should be taken out and given food decently made, and kept for another forty days.
E sia mermat de trebalh e de replecio de vianda e de beure, e de votz vehementz, quar quan usa de aquest regiment de sanacio entiera sira sanat.	He should be reduced to rest and work, and filled with food and drink, and gentle voices, for when he uses this regimen of healing, his entire body will be healthy.
E yeu diyre la curacio de las rupturas en las autras partidas del ventre, e so al comensament, e vols que no treguan, lahoras cauterisa la ruptura d’aquel am cauteri redon segon la quantitat de lu, e sia aquo que es exhurit de la codena ayssi cum la tersa partida de lu; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit, e no es ajustat.	And you should direct the healing of ruptures in other parts of the belly, and at first, let it be so that they do not bleed, then cauterize the rupture of that affected arm around according to its size, so that it is exhaled from the cord like the other part of him; and let heal that place as we have said, and if it does not adhere.
E ja diyssero alcus primiers que ruptura sia cauterizada am cauteri triangular segon aquesta forma, pus que es senhada am tenta:	They said that the first thing to be cauterized is rupture by triangular cautery, since it is marked with intent:
e es pausada linha que eys per la latitut en le latz pus sobira de la ruptura, e autra linha al desus; e depausa la tua ma am un cauteri clavilh, mays le primier cauteri es pus leugier e milhor.	It is paused a line that stretches from the latitude on the left side above the rupture, and another line below; and then place your hand with a pointed cautery, but the first cautery is lighter and better.

De cauterizacio de torcio.	On the cautering of knots.
Quan endeve en alscus membres per cazement o per percussio dolor e persevera aquela dolor per lonc temps e no comfereys al u curacio am medicinas, lahoras cove que cauterizes am cauteri de punt.	When you are in a swollen limb due to falling or percussion, and the pain persists for a long time, and you do not relieve it with medicine, then cover the wound with a pointed cautery.
E sia le cauteri de tot membre segon la magnitut e la parvitat de lu, e vertut e develitat de lu, e locacio de torcio e dolor de lu.	And it should be the cautery of the entire limb according to its size and diminution, virtue, and form, and location of the knot and pain.

So if the healing occurs with the first cautery, good; but if not, then repeat it over that limb again; because it is customary for those pains to be punctures on a nearby limb to which you approach, so that you may gain access to them with the cautery before the disease gets worse.

De cauterizacio de lepra.	Cauterization of leprosy.
Les lebros alcunas veguadas am cauteri per mot gran juvament, e magerment si la specia de lepra que es fayta per putrefaccio de flacma e de melencolia.	Some lepers are treated with cautery because of a great wound from childhood, but only if the leprosy is made by the putrefaction of flesh and melancholy.
E donc cum tu vols cauterizar aquel, considera si la lepra es comussan e as aquela curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no deysen, ni esta, e temes sobre le malaute que la corrupcio comprehenda tot le cors de lu e tota la compleccio de lu, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le cap am v cauteris: am un en le mieg loc del cap, e am le segon pus dejos de lu, eves le front a la fi dels cabels; e amdos sobre dos corns; e am un detras, sobre la nuca o servitz.	And therefore, if you want to cauterize that person, consider whether the leprosy is common and if it has been cured in the same way as what we have said in division, do not do so, and beware of the malady that the corruption will comprehend all the body of him and all his complexity, whereas when you cauterize on the head above the ears: one in the middle of the forehead, and the second just behind it, and above the hair; and two on the temples; and one behind, over the nape or ear.
E ultima la tua ma am le cauteri un pauc entro que emprema en le os una petita empressio, e de lu sian deslocadas las scorsas, per so que la expiracio de grossas vapors sia alleujada de lu; e cauteriza sobre la melsa segon que es precesit.	And finally, after placing the cautery a little inside before it takes hold on the bone a small impression, and from that the sores are displaced, because the expulsion of great vapors is alleviated from him; and cauterize on the skin according to what is required.

You know that the more you apply the cauterization, the greater the youth and vitality will be; and you know that a disease does not have pain in the cauterized part, just like it does elsewhere, therefore the body of the patient becomes stunned.
E cove que les cauteris sian grans o paucs segon les membres e las juncturas segon que es precedit de las specias dels ferramentz.	And consider that the cauterizations can be large or small depending on the members and joints according to what is preceded by the special instruments.

De cauterizacio de claus e dels autres semblants.	On the cautering of nails and other similar things.
Motas veguadas endeve a las partidas dejos del pe malautia que s’apela clau, e es causa grossa, fentrada, la qual ladeys le pe; e cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, so es cauteri am foc e cauteri am aygua cauda.	Small, thin things that enter the affected areas of the foot, which cause inflammation, are called nails, and are a great cause. Cauterizing in these places is done according to two methods: with focus (i.e., burning) or with cauterization by hot water.

If not converted, and frequent accidents occur on the surface of the body, particularly in the joints and feet, then cover that with cautery water, and place a quill made of iron or lead or nail of thunder over the key; and prick into the quill with a little quantity of watery juice, and let your hand rest, and you turn it with compression of your hand in all directions, so that the margin of the quill is pressed against the root of the key, and push the water to the bottom of the root with the quill; and wait for the patient for a little time after the prick of the watery juice by one hour, and then remove it, because the key has its roots eradicated.
E ayssi fe am aquels la i aprop l’autre entro que venguas sobre totz les quals de lor so en le cors.	It appears that pain in joints is caused by cold humors that infiltrate various parts of the body, leading to discomfort in the feet. The custom term used by doctors to describe this condition is "gout". To treat gout, points are made on the surface of the foot using a pointed cautery, and the area is then protected.
E aprop cura aquels pus que las razitz dels claus so erradicadas am aquo dels enguentz les quals la carn ve engenran.	The cure for the pus that appears in those areas, where the claws of the disease are eradicated, through the consumption of remedies, is to eliminate these purulent diseases from inside the body, causing the flesh to be irritated.

E quan deslias aquo e veses que l’apostema ja es diminuit, lahoras cove que fregua le os entro que comensa en lu nayser carn, e aprop cura aquel am regiment exsiccatiu le qual fassa neysser la carn, ayssi cum si tu prenes de farina de froment dos partidas e de colofania quatre partidas e mescla o, e de lor sia fayt emplastre e sia aministrat en aquestas plaguas a de la carn nativitat.	When this happens and the swelling has decreased, then cover that the bone is filled with something where it begins to eat flesh, and apply that wet dressing which makes flesh needed like as if you take two parts of wheat flour and four parts of vinegar and mix them together, and from there make a plaster and apply it on these wounds of flesh birth.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter VI.
De la cura de aquo que catz en las aurelhas.	On the treatment of those who suffer from headaches.
Tota causa que catz en las aurelhas es una de quatre specias, quar o es peyra mineral o causa semblant a peyra, ayssi cum ferr e veyre, o es de planta ayssi cum ceze o fava, o es causa fluxtibla ayssi cum aygua e vi agre e a lor semblantz, o alcuna bestia.	All the causes of headaches are one of four types: either a mineral cause or similar to a mineral, such as iron and vinegar, or a plant cause, such as cherry or bean, or a fluid cause, like water, wine, and vinegar, or some animal.
E donc quan peyra catz en l’aurelha o autra causa semblant de aquelas causas que no ajustan ne creysso en l’aurelha, e pausa la aurelha al solelh, e si vezes la peyra, lahoras distilla en aquela alcuna causa de oli violat o sizami, e aprop aministra la extraccio de lu, e fay le stornudar am condizi, e oppila las nars deve le aveniment de stornutacio. E si no n’es getada, lahoras aministra extraccio de lu am le instrument apelat gesti epicicarios subtil del qual aquesta es la forma:	If it is not forgotten, then provide extraction from him with the instrument called "gesti epicicarios subtle" of which this is the form:
E si es foro-getada am gesti, bo es; e sino, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am onci subtil de pauca duplicacio.	If it is forgotten with the gesture, then good luck; otherwise, provide extraction from him with an onion subtle of double duplication.

And therefore if it is not forgotten about all the causes that have been recounted, then apply the coat to such an extent that you will discover inflammation or spasm.
E la manieyra de talhar aquela es que tu al comensament sancnes le malaute de la vena sephasica e extratz del sanc segon la mannieyra de la vertut de lu, e aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas e converteys l’aurelha a las partidas desus, e fen am petita fissura en la razit de la aurelha deves lo greys de lu en le loc be premegut de lu.	And the method of cutting that is to first consecrate the sick vein and excise the surrounding flesh according to the virtue of it, and place your hand between your fingers and convert the elbow into its parts, and make a small fissure in the rate of the elbow with the grey color of him at the previous location.
E sia la fissura de figura lunar entro que pervengua a la peyra, e, la peyra atrobada, osta aquela si podes am instrumentz apropriatz; e aprop cos la fissura en aquela hora am velocitat, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	The text means: And if the crack in the lunar shape reaches the joint and the joint is crushed, then try to insert an appropriate instrument into it, and place that at once with speed, and cure it before it's healthy.

e aministra am aquel la abscizio de aquel gra lo qual es cazut en l’aurelha.	Administer the abscission of that fat which has fallen into the armpit.

And do not do this when you think that it has already been moistened by the vapor of the armpit, and place it in moist cloths, and extract from there in those manners or with gentle gestures, or as we said, which is alleviated the extraction of it.

But if there is a worm birth in the ear when you treat that area as described in division and in the treatment of dilators and do not confer your cure on it, frequently cover that ear with sunlight.

Capitol .vii.	Chapter VII.
De curacio de opilacio de aurelhas.	Of treatment for eyelid inflammation.
Alcunas veguadas alcus enfantz yeysso dels ventres de lors mayres no-perforatz, e aquo ja accideys en alcus homes, opilacio en le meat de la aurelha per plagua o per carn nada en aquela; e aquesta opilacio alcunas veguadas es fayta en le preon del trau de la aurelha la qual no consiec le vezement, e alcunas veguadas es en las partidas defora.	There are some cases where the eyelids are swollen because of a child's birth, without perforation, and this happens in some people, swelling of the skin on the eyelid due to infection or no reason at all; and sometimes this swelling is caused by the preauricular fold which the person does not notice, and sometimes it is outside.
E aquela que accideys en le preon de lu, la qual no comprehen le vezement, es en las majors disposicios de dificil sanacio.	A condition occurring in the groin area, which cannot be understood at first, is typically encountered in more complicated cases of illness.
E en aquela en qual consegueys le vezement, cove que tu pauses la aurelha del malaute al solelh e reguarda en aquela.	In that case where you are able to understand the situation, cover the armpit of the sick person with a cloth and look at it.
E donc si vezes oppulacio apparent, obre aquela am espatum subtil del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And therefore when oppression is apparent, take hold of the subtle staff which has this shape.
Si’ la extremitat de lu en la qual sia petita la latitut, del qual la una partida sia aguda e l’autra no; e le spatum sia de dos latz leon per so que no fassa lizio al aurelha.	If the extremity of him where his circumference is small, and one side is acute while the other is not, and the staff has two sides like a lion's claw, so that it does not irritate the armpit.
E donc si la opilacio es per carn nascuda en la aurelha o en le meat de lu, lahoras te aquela am oncis subtils e incidiys aquela vehement facilitat entro que sia ostada tota la carn.	And therefore if oppression is due to a natural growth in the armpit or on the flesh of him, then take that subtle staff and cut it into small pieces so as to apply great force until all the flesh is removed.
E si opilacio es en le preon de la aurelha, lahoras pren ray subtil leon e escalfa aquel am foc un pauc, e aprop met aquel en le meat de l’aurelha.	If oppression is in the groin of the armpit, then take a subtle lion's claw and scald it with fire for a little while, and place it on the flesh of the armpit.
E donc si as scentit oppulacio am aquo que le malaute atroba am facilitat, per gravetat de ausir, esforsa la oppressio de lu am facilitat; e guarda te que no plagues les nervis del aurelha.	If there is a swelling that the sickness overcomes with ease, due to gravity of not being able to overcome, force the oppression of it with ease; and beware so as not to plague the nerves of the ear.
E aprop pausa en l’aurelha drap de li segon la quantitat del ample del trauc lo qual tu as envolvutz en l’enguent egipciac; e fay aquo per alcus jorns entro que sias segur de la consolidacio de la plagua; o que prenguas qualgua e enfon aquela en ayguaros e pulveriza sobre lu segi trissat e usa de lu; e si vezes la aurelha ja esser apostemada, lahoras cove que tu estraguas la qualgua e permutes aquela am autra qualgua la qual tu envoloparas en cerot que sia fayt am oli rozat, entro que sia le apostema caut cedat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Stop in the ear with a cloth of linen according to the quantity of the width of the scratch which you have wrapped around the neck with Egyptian wool; and do this for three days until it is certain about the consolidation of the plague; or if you take water and put that into the ear and crush it, and pulverize over him sprinkled and using it; and if the ear is sometimes ulcerated, beware so as to cut that water and mix it with another water which you have wrapped around cotton that is made from olive oil soft, until the ulcer becomes calm.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras submergeys esponga o drap en aygua frega e pausa sobre la aurelha, e usa del autra curacio la qual restrengeys le flux del sanc, la qual es dita en le tractat de distillacio.	But if a flow of pus occurs, then immediately submerge the sponge or cloth in water and press it on the ear, and use another treatment which you will restrict the flow of the pus, which is mentioned in the book of distillation.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter VIII.
De cura de athezil le qual endeveno a las palpebras.	Treatment for a disease that affects the eyelids.
Athezil les quals endeveno a las paupebras dels huels alcuna veguada so humitz, alscunas veguadas son secs.	Athezil which affects the eyelids of newborns sometimes with no discharge, and sometimes with some discharge.

And the better cauterization is to cauterize and close the incisions and wounds that are often returned when there is still some cause for the finger; and when those fingers have been cauterized, they will be burned and will not return.
Capitol .ix.	Conclusion.
Cura de grandeyssa que veno a las palpebras dels huels.	Treatment for a growth that occurs on the eyelids of children.
Motas veguadas endeve en las palpebras dels huels alcuna causa la qual es asemblada a grandissa en sa fortalicia e duricia, e per so grandissia es apelada.	Moths that sometimes occur on the eyelids of children, often due to some cause which is assembled like a growth in strength and hardness, and for this reason, it is called a tumor.
E es agreguacio de humiditat grossa en la palpebra dejos e desus.	A large amount of humidity is added to the eyelids and underarms.
Donc la opperacio en lor es que consideras lahoras si la grandissia es procedent en lu en aquo que apar de la palpebra e es mauguda a tota partida; e la causa de lu es leugiera.	So, the operation for them is that one considers the swelling to be in what appears as a lump from the eyelid, and it is considered to be all over; and the cause of it is light.
Donc fen sobre aquela am fissura per la latitut, e aprop escorga aquela de tota partida am facilitat entro que evasesca, e aprop suspen aquela am onci e abscindeys aquela.	Therefore make an incision over that wound in latitude, and bring open that entire part with ease, then suspend it on one inch and cut it off.
Mays si a tu no es apparelhada la incizio de lu si no pus que penetras la palpebra am inscizio pauc a pauc, lahoras aquo no notz en deguna causa.	But if to you it is not suitable to begin the incision of him unless you pierce the eyelid with an incision little by little, because then there is no notice of any cause.
E si la figura es gran, lahoras tu l’ajusta am sutura; e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the figure is large, then you tie it up with a suture; and care for it until it heals.
E si es pauca, a tu no sobrevindra mal per aquela quar l’anguent de lu restaura aquela e encarna.	And if it is little, to you it will not cause much harm because the blood of him restores that and nourishes.
E si la grandissia es declinant a las partidas dedintz de la palpebra deves la superficia dedintz, lahoras evesa la palpebra e suspen la grandissia am onci, otra que tu indigescas de incizio, e prem aquela de tota part, e si la palpebra per inscizio es alonguada, aquo no notz en deguna causa.	And if the swelling is decreasing towards the parts outside of the eyelid, then you cover that surface, others cover the eyelid, and suspend the swelling on one inch, unless you need an incision; and press it into its entire part, and if the eyelid is swollen with incision, there will be no notice of any cause.
E aprop la incizio, lava le huel am aygua salada; e cura le loc am aquo que encarna entro que sia sanat.	Close the beginning, wash the foot in salted water; and cure the area with that which is inserted until it heals.
Capitol .x.	The end of a chapter or a section, equivalent to a modern "end of part X".
De la cura axcirnah en la palpebra desus del huel.	Of the cure for an ulcer on the upper eyelid.
Axcirnath es grays le qual es engendrat en las tunicas de la palpebra desus, e majorment endeve als enfantz, agrava les huels de aquels et accideyso a lor catartz le mayti; e no podon reguardar la claror del solelh per aquo quar lagremas se coytan ad aquels.	A scirnath is formed in the tunics of the upper eyelid, and more often in children, it worsens the ulcers in those and leads to their major catarrh; and one cannot look at the brightness of the sun without tears falling on them.
E per so tu vezes aquels jaser sobre les lors caras tot temps, e sobre les lors caras dormen; e so a las palpebras de lor dejos les sobrecils humidas, las quals ja ha cuberta imflacio, e iminencia de accernac apparent es en l’uelh; e que quant tu premes le loc am les tieus ditz, tu centes accernac entro aquels.	And so you should cover those ulcers with cloth over their faces all the time, and on their faces they sleep; and above their eyes put wet combs, which have previously covered inflammation, and imminent appearance of ophthalmia is in the eye; and when you press that area with your thumbs, you feel ophthalmia inside them.

There is no operation to be performed on one who pauses his head in your shoulder, and place a cloth of linen and wool moist with water; and make a circle according to the quantity that contains arthernach from all parting, and place it over that, press with your thumbs of all so that there is aggregation of ophthalmia in the middle of the circle, and then apply in the middle of that humidity with spatum incident on fissure, lest the fissure be greater than the fissure made in flaubotomia.
Mays en le preon cove que tu fendas la codena tota entro que pervenguas ad arcernach, quar en las mays desposicios proceseys arcernach per fissura segon la forma de grayseza blanca.	The translation is:
Donc extratz aquela am draps los quals tu as envolopatz entre les tieus ditz a las partidas deforo e revolv entre la ma dextra e sinistre entro que sia dispargut. E guarda te que no ajustes en la fissura per so que am le spatum no pervenguas al huel e ladescas aquel.	And guard yourself so that you do not tighten in the fissure, lest the splint does not go through to the heel and hurts the toes.

E so alcus que trissan sal e pausan aquel en la conquavitat de la fissura per so que aquo que es remas de aquela humiditat.	And so you will crush salt and place it in the cavity of the fissure, so that what remains of that humidity.

De manieyras de tactimi del huel.	Repetitive motions of touching or stroking.
Quan en las palpebras dels huels so natz pels ajustatz dejos les pels naturals e so antiquatz, lahoras aquels noso al huel e fan endevenir manieras de malautias ayssi cum lacrimas assiduas e mollificacio de palpebras e tela entro que aquo sia causa de destruccio del huel que s’apela tactinir del huel, e cura se en quatre manieyras: o per cauteri am foc; o am medicina acuta segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri; o es fayt atactini per inscizio e sutura; o per cannas segon que yeu diyre.	When the eyelids of the patient swell with inflammation due to friction, and they are natural and smooth again, it is customary that no one touches or handles them, as this causes excessive tearing, softening of the eyelids, and skin irritation which can lead to damage of the eye that requires touching, and cure is done in four ways: by applying cauterization with fire; by applying acute medicine according to what is said in the chapter on cauterization; by performing touch therapy by incision and suture; or by using needles as you have instructed.
E donc cove que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se; aprop converteys la palpebra del uelh am la tua ma sinistra, e si es convertida, bo es; e sino, entromet agulha en aquela en la qual sia fiel de la partida pus dejos de la palpebra, e fay penetrar la agulha am fiel desus, e aquo sia — prop del marge de la palpebra en le qual naysso les pels — prop dels pels, e tira le fiel a las partidas desus am la palpebra, e converteys aquela am le ray. Capitol .xxiv.	Section 24.

De extraccio de sancguisugua annexsa al golayro.	Removal of infected pus attached to the groin.
Quan es medicada sanguisugua am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la curacio am medicinas e no comfereys, considera lahoras en le guolayro del malaute al solelh, pus que tu aias compremuda la lengua de lu am instrument le qual a tu havem recomtat.	When the infected pus is treated with that medicine which has been discussed in the division of wounds and medications, and you do not comfort it, consider this in the groin area of the patient exposed to the sun, so that you compress the tongue of the patient with an instrument to which you have attached.
Donc si tu vezes la sancguisugua, extratz aquela am onci petit o am gesti subtils decentment.	So if you squeeze the pus, extract that with an onion or with gentle gestures in a decent manner.
E si no es a tu possible estrayre am aquel, lahoras pren una canula concava e entromet aquela en lo guolayro del malaute, e aprop pausa en la concavitat de la canula un ferr ignit, e fay aquo tantas vetz (entro que la sancguisugua sia morta e se osta del guolayro) e abstengua se le malaute tot lo jorn de aygua.	And if it is not possible to extract it, then take a concave tube and insert that into the groin area of the patient, place a hot iron in the concavity of the tube, and do this many times (until the pus is dead and comes out of the groin) and abstain from letting the sick person drink water all day.
E aprop prengua una veyria plena de aygua frega, e obra la boca de lu en aquela, e lava la boca am aquela; e no trasglucia de aquela alcuna causa e maugua l’aygua una hora aprop autra am la sua ma, quar la sancguisugua tantost cum sent l’aygua catz.	And take a vessel full of water, wet the mouth of the patient with it, and wash the mouth with that; and do not pass over any cause or insult from that area, but let the water sit for another hour on the other side with your hand, because soon after the pus starts to feel the coldness.
Mays si no es foro-getada am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras subfumigua le malaute am cimetz o am assafetida per le instrument le qual havem recomtat en la sufumiguacio de uvula.	The translation is: "But if it has not been forgotten at all, then the disease is hidden in the joints or in the excrement through the instrument which we have counted in the inhalation of the uvula.
Fay aquo, so en quar cayra.	The translation is: "And it is so, on which day.
E es un’autra manieyra de operacio en sufumiguacio de aquela, es que tu prenguas una ola en la qual sian carbos ignitz e la ola sia cuberta am una cobertora en le mieg de la qual sia un trauc, e sia compausat en aquel trauc la extremitat del instrument; e aprop dega desus la subfumigacio; e pause le malaute la sua boca en la extremitat de la canula, e claugua la sua boca per que la subfumiguacio no sia foro-getada entro que sapias que la subfumigacio es pervenguda a la sancguisugua, quar la sancguisugua tantost cayra.	The translation is: "And there is another method of operation in the inhalation of this one, that you take a ball which are carbon sparks and the ball is covered with a covering in the middle of which is a thread, and composed of that thread the extremity of the instrument; and then take away the submersion; and place the patient's mouth at the extremity of the tube, and close their mouth so that the submersion is not forgotten until you know that the submersion is carried out to the sanguisuga, which will be broken soon.
E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.	The translation is: "If not, then you do the submersion many times again, and abstain from giving the patient drink, and make them eat salted food and ash, and do not give them water, and thus it is necessary that this regimen be forgotten.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument am le qual es trayta sancguisugua del guolayro quan es vista; e es semblant a forceps ayssi cum vezes, sino quar es en lu alcuna curvitat:	This is the form of the instrument with which we extract pus from the gallbladder when it is seen; and it resembles forceps just like this sometimes, but not when there is no curvature.
le qual sia mesa al guolayro, e la extremitat de lu es semblant a bec de ciconia, que es guanta, en la qual es aspretat de lima, per so quar, quan comprem alcuna causa, aquela no leyssa.	which is set on the gallbladder, and the extremity of it is like the beak of a stork, which is strong, in which lime is sharpened, so that when we press any cause, it will not lose its grip.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter XL.
En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	In which the sum of the sermon is in observation of ulcers, and in section of them.
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	The ulcers are marked with special signs, in various ways, according to their memory of them, from each one in this book.
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	They are diverse in perforation and section of them, according to two ways: one is by the special nature of ulcers themselves, and by that which we take from humidity.
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	And the second way is to those places where accidents occur in the body, since an ulcer occurs on the head is different from one that occurs on the anus, and a skin ulcer differs from one that occurs in joints; and each of them has its own law for operation.
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	And many of the boils which cover have the power that they should not be perforated unless at maturity of the sickness in those places or completion of them.
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	And other boils that cover have the power to be torn when they are crossed, and not after their completion, just like boils that are caused at joints, because a boil that appears near a joint is prolonged until you pierce it, as long as it is in the circuit of it, and it strongly corrupts the ligaments or nerves of that joint, causing contraction of that member; or it is a boil close to the main member, if you delay perforating it until it has matured, it will cause harm to the main member; or it is near the anus, therefore perforate the one that is not yet mature; and do not dare to pierce the rough one, of incomplete digestion, but the one that is proper to the anus, so that you can prevent its spread and be elongated towards the parts outside of the anus, and it will form a fistula, or be made in the termination of it that is not healing.
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	You know when to pierce the boil, and that is when it has matured.
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	When the swelling of pain and fever have ceased, and the decrease of redness and pulse, and the sharpness of the tumor's head, and other signs.
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	Wherever you know that the perforation must be made in the place where the pus is left behind after the healing of the prominence.
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	Perforation should be made at a suitable time, either along the length of the skin or the body, if the swellings are in the arms or feet, and in places such as the joints, ligaments of the nerves, arteries; and finally, in all places where there is no reflection, whereas in those that do reflect, use perforation according to the affected member.
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	But when the swelling is in the flesh, rather quickly apply the perforation of it, before the body has fully digested and confirmed its complement, as they say; for if you perforate it first, the course of the pus will be prolonged, and with more filthiness, and the labia of the mouth will be severely hardened and the depth of it.
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	But if the swelling is in a location that requires more penetration of the flesh or the body, or according to the necessity, or because of the member affected.
E cove que administres petita perforacio , e·n les apostemas grans gran perforacio e ampla o motas seccios segon la diversitat de la grandesa dels apostemas.	A medical condition can be treated by making a small puncture, and in the case of large appendicitis, a larger puncture is made with multiple smaller ones according to the size of the appendix.
E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.	Other cases of appendicitis exist where the cord is cut and incised, when it's done with a stick or made in a way that leaves a mark just like what happens in diseases such as dropsy and bubonic fever.
E de aquels so que so insciditz am seccio havent tres angles; e de aquels es en le qual es inscidit ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirtra, ayssi cum las apostemas dels angonars.	And those that are incised have three angles; and of those is where it's incised like the shape of a myrrh leaf, like the appendicitis of the anguine ( likely referring to someone with an ascitic fluid related condition).
E de lor so en les quals es administrada seccio redonda e seccio lunar, e semblantz ad aquels.	And of those there is a way in which round section and lunar section are administered, similar to them.
Mays aquel al qual no es cap ayssi cum son apostemas leons superficials, cove que tu perforas aquel am perforacio superficial, o plana tant solament.	But of those where there is none like their superficial appendicitis, one can be treated by making a superficial perforation, or a flat one alone.
E cove quant le apostema es gros e ya ha colligit mota sania, que perfores aquel e no te coytes que extraguas tot le poyre en aquela hora; habantz extratz de aquel una partida, e aprop opila le apostema entro al autre dia, e aprop extratz una partida major, e aprop fa aquo motas veguadas segon graduacio entro que sia foro-getat.	And when the appendix is large and has accumulated thick pus, one must perforate it without extracting all of the pus in that hour; extract a part from it, place the inflamed appendix inside another day, and then extract a larger part, and make this multiple times according to degree so that it is forgotten.
E majorment si·l malaute es de freol vertut, o femna prens, o enfant petit, o viel en decrepitut, quar l’esperit animal motas vetz es resolvut am la egressio de la sania, e fort leu mor le malaute, e tu operte les.	It is more so if the sickness is due to gallstones or a female's menstrual cycle, or an infant or an old person, because the animal's spirit moves towards the exit of the body through pain and suffering, and it weighs little upon death, and you open them up.
Don guarda aquest capitol am gran cautela, e aprop la tua perforacio en la qual perforas aquestz apostemas, cove que abstergescas las plagues e consideras donc si la plagua del apostema es pauca, o es una seccio plana, lahoras tu aministra las qualguas de li o de coto antic; e si le apostema es gran, e las fissuras de la perforacio son motas, lahoras cove que tu pauses meca en quascun trauc entro que pervenguan ensemps.	Do carefully guard this chapter and place your perforation in the location where you perforate these swellings, how ever, before you cleanse them of diseases and consider whether the disease of the swelling is little or a flat section, then you will manage its wounds according to old customs; and if the swelling is big, and the fissures of the perforation are small, then carefully cover your means in between where they will come together again.
E si en le apostema es abscindit una partida de la codena o has concavada aquela en le circuit, lahoras cove que tu la complescas de coto viel o de fil fayt de drap de li, ayssi cum quan has traytz pans o razizos, ses humiditat; e strenh aquel entro al tertz dia; e aprop proceseys aquel e cura le am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	If the tendon is torn apart in the swelling or you have scooped it out in its circumference, then how ever, cover and tie it with old cloth or with yarn made from linen, just like you would tie strips or pads, with humidity; and strengthen it within for three days; and afterwards proceed to process it and cure it with that which is suitable against diseases until it heals.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc en la hora de la operacio tua, lahoras tu aministra aygua frega e vi agre en les quals mules un drap de li, e pausa aquel sobre le loc del fluxs del sanc motas veguadas.	But if it happens that there is a flow of blood in the hour of your operation, how ever, administer cold water and vinegar on those which will put on linen cloth, and place that over the location of the flowing blood several times.
Mays si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras cove que tu aministres regiment e curacio e polveras las quals he recomtadas en motz locs de aquest nostre libre e de divisio.	When the purging of the sickness persists, then know that you must administer the regimen and cure, and powder those I have recommended in various places of this book and of division.
Mays si es en temps de hivern, e·l loc de la apostema es loc de motz nervis, lahoras cove que tu enfundas pulvils en vi e oli caut, e pauses aquels sobre les locs.	But if it is in the winter, and the location of the abscess is near nerves, then know that you must infuse powder in vinegar and oil, and place those on the affected area.
E si es en estiu, e les locs son carnoses, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils enbeguts am aygua e oli o am vi e oli, e tot aquo sia freg entro que sia le ters dia, ayssi cum havem dit, e lahoras cove que tu deslies le apostema e abstergescas aquel e aministres en la curacio de lu aquo que a lu conveneys entro que sia sanat.	But if it is in summer, and the locations are fleshy, then know that you must pause powdered embers with water and oil, or with vinegar and oil, and apply everything until it reaches a clear day, as they have said, and later, know that you must remove the abscess and clean it, and administer to it the cure that is suitable for it, until it heals.
E aysso es aquo que es necessari de la cognicio de la curacio de apostemas universalment, mays segon la via de distinccio ja he dit de tot apostema en qual manieyra es via de la cura de lu per capitols singularment.	And this is also what is necessary for the knowledge of the universal cure for abscesses, but as I have already said in my previous distinction, where I described each type of abscess and how to treat it in a specific way.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter 41.
De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.	Bleeding from the sebaceous glands that occur on the neck of the head.
En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.	On the neck of the head, small sebaceous glands occur, and these contain nodules with tunics that are their own kind; and the nature of these is described.
E de lor son pingas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditat semblant a lima.	And from them issue pimples, and those contain humidity similar to lime.
E de aquelas so las quals conteno humiditat semblant a pols, et asemblantz a lor; e de aquelas so que son lapideas, durs.	And from those that contain humidity similar to snow, and resembling them; and from those that are lapidous, hard.
E en la seccio de totz, e en la extraccio de aquels no es temor, cum deves la exteccio de aquels no fa contrariat arceria.	And in the section of all, and in the extraction of those, there is no fear, as one should not harm the surrounding tissue when removing them.
E la operacio en seccio de aquels es que tu esproes aquels am instrument la forma del qual ve aprop aysso, le qual es apelat entromes, entro que sapias que contengua.	And the operation of removing those is that you press upon those with an instrument in the shape which you approach, which is called entromes, where you did not know what it contained.
Quar si aquo que conte es humiditat, lahoras scindeys aquel am seccio segon la longitut per seccio superficial segon aquesta forma:	Why if this contains humidity, you then cut it apart with section according to length by section superficial according to this form:
E comensa en la seccio de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G. Donc cum la humiditat es evacuada, lahoras tu excoria aquela pel que conte aquela humiditat, e no leysses de aquela alcuna causa de tot, quar tropas veguadas retorna, si roman de aquela alcuna causa.	When the humidity is evacuated from between lines B and G, then you should scrape off that skin where the humidity was present, and do not neglect any other cause of its occurrence, because it has been seen to return, if it remains from any of those causes.
E aprop submergeys coto en enguent egipciach, si es present, e sino, en aygua e sal; e umpleys am aquel la plagua e layssa aquel entro ad autra dia, quar am aquo corrodeys tot so que es romas de aquela pellicula.	And now you should submerge the wound in Egyptian vinegar if it is present, and if not, in water with salt; and fill it up with that wound, letting it be smooth within another day, because this corrosion will continue until that skin falls off.
E aprop itera sobre aquel coto am enguent egipciach segondament e tersament si indigeyses de lu, entro que·t comfides que no y haia romas alcuna causa de aquela pellicula; lahoras cura la plagua am enguent entro que sia sanada.	And now you should iterate over that wound with the Egyptian vinegar second and third time if it is necessary, until you are certain that no other cause falls off that skin; then cure the wound with vinegar until it is healed.
E si apostema conte nodi gras, lahoras tu inscideys aquel segon aquesta forma:	If an apostema has a knot of fat, then you should incise it in that way.
am seccio havent forma de crotz, e geta oncis entre doas labias de la seccio e scorsa aquel de tota partida, e esforsa la tua vertut en extraccio de la tunica la qual conte aquel.	In the section with the form of a cross, get an incision between two folds of the section and cut it from top to bottom, and force your virtue in extracting the skin that contains it.
Mays si a tu arceria fa contrarieta, lahoras fay aquo que yeu t’e recontat primieyrament.	When archery causes opposition or reaction in you, then do so because I will recount to you primarily.
E semblantment fay en le apostema lapificat de seccio e de curacio segon que a tu havem dit; e seccio sobre apostema lapificat es pus leugiera, quar es de pauc sanc e de pauca humiditat.	Similarly do for the inflamed appendix of section and healing according to what you have said; and section of an inflamed appendix is lighter because it has few scars and little humidity.
E alcunas vetz so alcus de aquestz apostemas les quals so en le cap en alcus homes am los quals de tot no es humiditat; la qual causa es quar yeu inscindigui sobre un apostema en le cap de una femna vielha e atrobegui le apostema ayssi cum peyra sorda, aspra, blanqua, la qual no podia esser trinquada, e si a alcu fos am aquela percussit, plaguera aquel.	Some swellings have been described of these appendices which are in the head on swollen men with whom from all it is no humidity; this cause is because I separated an appendix in the head of an old woman and pierced it as if it were a deaf, harsh, white thing which could not be pierced, and if anyone touched that area would be wounded.
Mays en les autres apostemas accidentz en le cap otra aquest no es aquest capitol, ayssi cum les apostemas que veno als caps dels enfantz e deves las razitz de las aurelhas, mays la seccio de aquestz totz sia seccio superficial.	But in other appendages that occur on the head it is not this, just like those that come to the heads of children and are due to the auriculas; but the section of these is only superficial.
E pausa la perforacio de aquels de la partida pus bassa de lor per so que sia alleujat le cos de la sania a las partidas pus bassas.	And pause the perforation of those from the lower end down, in order that the body may be alleviated at the lower parts.
E aprop cura aquelas am aquo que conveneys ad aquel de curacio.	Heal those who are already being healed at the same time as you are.
Capitol .xlii.	Section Forty-two.
De seccio de scrophulas las quals accideyso en le col.	Of the section of scrofula, which occurs in the neck.
Motas veguadas endeveno aquestas apostemas en le colh e en las aysselhas e en les angonars; e alcunas veguadas accideyso en las autras partidas del cos.	Sore spots are frequently found on the neck, and in the axillaries, and in the armpits; and some occur on other parts of the body.
E so aquelas que accideysso en le colh, e so motas que so engendradas entre lor, e tota scrofula de aquelas es dintz la sua tunica propria, e ayssi cum en les nodis e apostema del cap, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And these that occur on the neck are those that are produced between them, and all scrofula in its own particular cavity, as in the nodes and swellings of the head, as with a retracted crown.
E las specias de aquestas scrophulas son motas, quar de aquelas so alcunas lapideas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditatz, e de aquelas so malignas las quals no obeseysso a curacio.	And the kinds of these scrofulae are swellings, which some have lumpy, others contain moisture, and those which are malignant do not heal.
Donc en aquela la qual tu vezes de bona disposicio en le Tocament, de la qual la color de aquo que es manifest es propda a la color de la codena, e es mauguda a tota partida, e no es annexsa am le nervi del colh, ni am las venas, ni am la arceria, e no es preonda, cove que tu inscidiscas aquela am siccio superficial de la partida desus a la partida dejos del cos de la linha de .G. entro la linha de .B., e scorja aquela de tota partida, e exten dos labias de la codena am onci, o am motz oncis si has necessitat de aquels, ayssi cum havem dit en las apostemas del cap, e extratz aquela petit a petit.	Therefore in that one which you treat with good disposition in the Touching, of which the color is manifest and is proper to the color of the tendon, and is malignant throughout the whole part, and is not attached to the nerves of the neck, nor to the veins, nor to the arteries, but only on the surface, like a superficial drying of the part from the previous part down to the lower part of the body from the line G to the line B, scrape off that entire part, and extend the lips of the tendon by one or two inches if necessary, as they have said in the swellings of the head, and gradually remove it.
E es mays cautela que no sia inscidida la vena o nervi.	It's not safe for blood vessels or nerves to be punctured unnecessarily.
E sia le spatum no mot agut, que no ajuste a tu la tua ma am inscizio, o que enquiete le malaute, e que inscidas aquo que no es necessari inscidir; quar si inscideysses vena o arceria e prohibeys tu de la tua operacio, lahoras pausa en la plagua vetriol trissat o autras polveras las quals ostan fluxs de sanc, e estrenh la plagua, e layssa aquel entro que·s repausa la acuitat de la apostema e sia mollificada la plagua e comense esser poyrida.	It is not advisable to prick the spot carelessly, lest you injure yourself or the patient, or puncture something that should not be pierced; and if you do pierce a vein or artery, stop immediately from your operation, then pause on the polluted wound, or other powders which obstruct the flow of pus, and reopen it, and allow it to heal so that the swelling subsides, and the ulcer becomes soft and commences to dry.
Quan le sanc es abscindit.	When the pus is separated.
Donc retorna a la tua operacio entro que l’aias complida.	Then return to your operation once you have completed it.
E aprop inquireys am le tieu dit indic si es romas alcuna causa de las autras petitas scrophulas, donc inscideys aquelas e munda aquelas.	And then inquired about the symptoms you have described if there is any other cause of smaller swellings, so puncture those and cure those.
E si es en la razit de la scrophula gran vena, cove lahoras que no inscidas aquela scrophula de la sua razitz.	And if the swelling is in the direction of a large vein, cover it so that you do not puncture that vein.
Abantz cove que lies aquela am fiel doblat fort e que leysses aquela entro que caia per si ses nocument.	Cover well so that the vein is tied tight and you see it through until it stops bleeding by itself.
E aprop omple la plagua de coto vielh le qual tu has ja submirgit en enguent egipciac, e aprop cura aquel.	Fill in the wound of old age which you have already submitted to the Egyptian eggplant, and cure that.
E si inscides aquela scrophula tota, lahoras cove que tu ajustes las doas labias de la plagua e cuzas2 tantost pus que no y ha romasa deguna superfluitat.	If you cut the scrofula completely, then cover the two lips of the wound and tie tightly so that no more pus comes out.
Mays si tu vezes que haia romasa superfluitat per la grandeza de la scrofula, cove que tu entendas a inscidir la razit de aquela, e astrayra aquela e aministra sutura e aquo que es dit.	But if there is no more excess because of the size of the scrofula, cover that you understand the reason for cutting it, and carry out suturing accordingly, as it says.
E aquela de las scrophulas que conteno humiditatz, perfora aquela am perforacio superficial aqui la on appar a tu le loc de maturacio de lu, e pausa perforacio de aquo que siec le pus bas del cos, ayssi cum havem dit.	And that of the scrofulas containing humidity, perforate it with superfluous perforation here at the location of its maturity, and pause the perforation so that the pus dries up from under the body, as they say.

De seccio de apostemas que accideysso per arceria o per vena.	On the section of swollen nodes that occurs due to aching or from the vein.
Quan arceria es rompuda, e la codena es consolidada la qual es sobre aquela, lahoras motas veguadas accideys apostema E les senhals per les quals es conoguda que imflamacio e apostema sian per la arteria o per vena: quar quan apostema es per arceria es lonc agreguat en le preon del cors; e que quan inpelleysses le apostema am les tieus ditz, sentes en lu quays sia stridor.	When the aching is broken and the tendons are consolidated above it, then move around to find swollen nodes, for in such cases inflammation and swelling occur due to an artery or vein: when the swelling occurs because of aching, it is long and swollen in the region of the body; and when you feel the swelling with your fingers, you hear a stridor.
E aquel que es per vena es redon al manifest del cors.	And that which occurs due to a vein is round in the shape of the body.
E seccio sobre aquest apostema es error, e majorment en aquel que es dejos las aysselhas, e en les angonars, e en le col, e en motz locs del cors; e es mot gran, donc cove que la sua curacio am ferr sia esquivada, e aquel que es en las extramitatz, o al cap, cove que sia evitat.	This section is an error, and more so in those cases where the swollen nodes are found on the joints, and on the neck, and on other parts of the body; and it is very large, therefore, one must be cautious not to miss its cure, for if it is left untreated, it will spread, whereas if it occurs in the extremities or near the head, it should be avoided.
Mays sobre aquel que es de lor per imflacio de l’orrifici de la arceria, scindeys en la codena seccio en le lonc; e aprop huebre la seccio am uncis e aprop la arceria, e deliura de las tunicas entro que sia descuberta.	A person who is crippled by their own bowing due to the arrow wound in the leg should be cut into sections along the joint; and take out the section with an incision, and remove the arrow, and free the tunics that are under it.
E aprop met sobre aquel agulha e fay aquela penetrar entro al autre latz, e estrenh la arceria am fiel doble en dos locs, — la qual causa yeu a tu eyssenhegui en extraccio de doas arcerias les quals so en les templars.	And place metal over that arrow, and make it penetrate into the other lat (lateral space), and stretch the arrow with a strong double bond in two places, — which causes you to have an extraction of two arrows, those which are found in the temples.
E aprop punh le loc le qual es entre dos liamentz am spatum entro que yesca le sanc tot que es en lu, e sia dissolvut le apostema.	Apply a poultice in the place that is between two joints, and smear it with salt inside as much as it can be, and dissolve the swollen tissue.
E aprop administra curacio en la qual es engendrat poyre entro que caian les liamentz; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz convenientz ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	Administer a remedy in which the purging is generated, so that the joints fall apart; and cure him with an ointment fitting to the disease, until he is healed.
E si es apostema per seccio de vena, lahoras cove que tu tenguas am la tua ma aquo que es a tu possible del apostema am la codena, e aprop intromet la agulha dejos le loc le qual tu has tengut dejos la tua ma, e fay aquela penetrar; e sia en aquela fil doble entro que tu extraguas aquel del autre latz, e aprop ligua le apostema am bo liament segon que yeu he dit a tu en le liament de uva4 de doas partz am doas extremitatz del fil.	If the swelling is due to a vein section, then cover yourself with your hand on that spot because it has a similar swelling in the same place in the cord, and insert the needle into the same place where you have placed your hand; and make it penetrate; and tie the swelling with two ligatures according to what I have said to you in the vine's joint at both ends of the vein in both extremities.
Mays si temes que extraguam le fil, lahoras entromet le fiel am aquela agula dejos tot le apostema deves la inscizio de la agulha primieyra, e strenh les tieus fiels en quatre locs.	If you fear that the thread will be pulled out, then insert the needle into the wound with the same angle as before, and pull your threads in four places.
Aprop secca le apostema en le mieg loc de lu entro que quan es yssit aquo que es en lu, lahoras tu inscideys la superfluitat de la codena, e layssa aquo que de lu es liat.	Then dry the swelling in the middle of the wound until it subsides and becomes less swollen, and insert a cord loosely around it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu pulvil le qual has submergit en vi e oli, e aprop administra la curacio la qual es fayta am calguas e enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And place over it the poultice which you have submerged in vinegar and oil, and administer the cure which is made with caustic and enema until it heals.
Capitol l del apostema le qual accideys per torcio de nervis.	Caput of the swelling that occurs from twisting of nerves.
Ayssi cum accideys apostema en arceria e en vena, e semblantment accideys apostema en les nervis quan accideys en lor percussio o accideys per trebal superfluable, e per semblantz.	There is swelling in the tendon and vein, and similarly occurs swelling in the nerves when they are compressed or injured by excessive tension.
E es fayt le mays de lu en les locs dels adjutoris o del talo, o en tot loc en le qual so maugudas las juncturas.	And it is more common in the region of the knee joints or ankle, or in any place where the joints are worn out.
E es apostema greu, e es asemblat a la color del autre cors, e es en las majors de lu disposicios ses de lor e quan es streyt am vehementia, sent en lu le malaute semblant stupor.	And it is severe swelling, and resembles the color of the other body parts, and is in the major joints of the limbs, and when stretched, it causes mental confusion, and one feels like a sickness that is similar to stupor.
E no es apostema agreguat en le preon del cors, e per so es dejos la codena, e el es maugut a tota partida e no va a las partidas denant ni detras.	It is not an abscess that is added to the prepuce of the body, and for this reason it is left open, and he is allowed to go to all parts and does not go to the front or back.
Donc aquo de aquels que es en las juncturas no cove que sia envasit am ferr, quar fort leu endevenguera contracio.	But this of those who are in the joints does not cover that it should be filled with iron, for because he will seek a contraction.
Mays aquel que es en le cap o en le front fen la codena am spatum.	But the one who is in the head or on the forehead feels the cord being pulled with a rod.
Mays si es apostema pauc, lahoras te aquel am les forfecs e abscindeys aquel de razitz.	But if it is an abscess little, then tear open those with the fingers and cut away that one from the flesh.
E si es gran, lahoras tu le suspen am unci, e excorja aquel, e aprop osta aquel; e ajusta la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if it is large, then suspend it with an onion, and excoriate that one, and take out that one; and fasten the wound with stitches, and cure it until it heals.
